content:
Posted: December 11, 2013
												SASRT  (=Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed) might be a Mario Kart clone, but that doesn't stop it from blowing the original out of the water.Where Mario Kart games can really feel like they're mostly based on luck, SASRT is mostly  based on skill, even though you can still get a good item that would help you get the upperhand, but even then, you'll still have to use it wisely and have the skill to do so, or it will be completely useless.Where Mario Kart games' races can feel pretty uninspired, SASRT's races are a pretty great demonstration of intelligent level-design. Every single inch of the races are calculated to reward you if you're doing good and punish you if you screw up.Where Mario Kart games pace can feel  boring, SART's pace will barely allow you some time to blink.Where Mario kart games single-player will gladly leave you the  first place in any race on any difficulty setting and make sure the closest opponent stays a mile away from you, SASRT's AI will rather hunt you down and take you out like there's a billion dollars bounty on your headAnd don't get me wrong, I love Mario kart, especially Double Dash on gamecube. But Sega's SASRT is just so good it makes Mario Kart games looks like they're the SASRT clones.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is a joyous, colorful and pretty unique kart racing game that features a large number of characters and tracks mostly from various Sega games. Naturally, Sonic is the star here, but there are other characters here as well some of which you wouldn’t expect in this kind of game. The Steam version features additional characters from Team Fortress 2, Football Manager, Company of Heroes 2, Shogun: Total War and Total War: Rome II.The most unique concept that the game offers is right there in the title. Every car automatically transforms into a boat or a plane at different parts of the track. Not only that, but most tracks change from lap to lap as well. This makes the racing very dynamic, unpredictable and varied. The controls feels good, but they get more and more demanding as you change difficulty levels as the game automatically disables certain assists. Both casual and hardcore players can get the most out Transformed as you can change the difficulty at any time and enjoy the game at your own pace.Transformed doesn’t have a classic campaign, but it rather offers a World Tour consisting of a slightly non-linear series of a wide variety of events including classic races, battle races, versus, boost/drift/checkpoint challenges, and so on. This mode will unlock characters, tracks and mods. Mods let you slightly customize your vehicle in a very limited way. Each mod has a series of predetermined parameters which change up the ratios between speed, acceleration, boost, handling, etc. Apart from World Tour, there’s also Grand Prix which lets players compete in five tournament cups and time trial, single race and multiplayer.The graphics are great, the game is colorful and bright, each track is completely different both in its look and design. Unfortunately, the soundtrack is pretty much what you would expect from a game like this (or any Sega game, to be honest) – horribly cheerful retro synth and guitar melodies. Thankfully, it blends in well and you won’t notice it much at all.Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed does what it sets out to do very well. It’s simple and joyous yet challenging and skillful. The gameplay is fast and fun, the track design is varied and imaginative and there are plenty of modes that will keep you entertained for a long time.7 OUT OF 10 (GOOD)

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												Blows Mario Kart out of the water.It's called Sonic and All-Stars, but in reality this is a SEGA racing game featuring loads of characters from iconic games like Sonic, Space Channel 5, Crazy Taxi, Super Monkeyball, pretty much anything SEGA has ever made including stuff I hadn't even heard of, you'll race on tracks with themes like Golden Axe, Outrun, Afterburner, House of the Dead, you name it.A lot of the tracks change for different laps, like Sky Sanctuary falling apart forcing the racers to fly, or ships crashing on the Skies of Arcadia level. The game is running on CryEngine meaning it looks spectacular. It's quite hard to find Kart games on PC (nobody mention Tux Racer), but this is a real gem. Technically it's very polished, full native 360 controller support, appropriate graphics options, amazing graphics, good music, it feels like SEGA poured a lot of love into this game. My only complaint is that I wish there was more weapon variety.

Posted: March 24, 2016
												Online is a disconnect from servers simulator. so many times have i actually been able to do good in a race just to be told there was a network error that kicks me offline. worse yet theres a penalty for leaving an online race on your rating off 100 points, which is the most you can make in a single race which you get by completing the race in first but only when your rating is♥♥♥♥♥♥ Speaking of the rating system, it's ridicolous. the higher the rating you have, the less points you get for completing an online race. getting first place eventually reduces that 100 points  you earn to low amounts such as only 4 points. an example is 1st place will get you from 1100 to 1200, but if you're at 1600 you'll get around 40 points instead.  you even get less points taken away if someone with a high rating wins the race and more taken away if someone with a low rating wins the race. making a rating system (which is useless in video games anyhow...) even more useless.singleplayer requires you to be absolutely perfect at everything to unlock everything (including mods for characters that change vehicle stats) and the AI, like many reviews have said, cheats. items are even more bizzarre this time around, looking to have absolutely no influence from any of the games that the characters you play as come from.flying and driving physics are ok but water section are horrible due to actual water physics (such at a tiny wave turning you into a small rock skipping on water). my one problem with flying is that inability to fire backwards, which you can only do by holding backwards which causes your vehicle to nose-dive or fly directly upward, depending on your controls.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
The bad:-Weak characters. Although I'm far from unlocking the full set of characters in this game, the designs and vehicles go from okay (Tails, Wreck-it Ralph) to curious (Alex Kidd, Ryo) to friggin' awesome (Metal Sonic, Knuckles), to weak (Team Fortress) and finally to absolutely baffling. Football Manager, The *TWO* Total War characters and General Winter feel incredibly out of place and in the case of the last one, are kinda cringeworthy to drive while hearing WW2-era Soviet slogans and choral music when activating the special. And that's a shame, because I feel some of the designs are pretty neat but could have been way better if they had been designed as original themed characters instead of weak plug-ins for games that just don't belong in this game. I'm going to ignore Yogscast because it's the only thing that deserves, and only going to comment on the fact that it's kind of the sign that Sega really didn't care about making iconic, enduring, compelling characters opting instead for the founder of a podcast that not only has a history of publisher extortion, is an ugly and annoying turd in a box racer.Come on, Sega. You have way more franchises to take characters from than selling the spots in your game to the highest bidder. where's the OutRun car? Daytona USA?? Any of the Virtua games!? Golden Axe and House of the Dead could have been used for more than a track, and if we get into multi-platform characters there's a plethora from which to choose, from Sparkster to James Pond. Friggin' Battletoads. I could go all day. Tons of characters whose developers I'm sure would chip in to see fan interest in those properties renewed.Somewhat iffy controls on certain flips but especially when it comes to firing weapons. Plane sections require you to press up and down, which is also used to choose to fire in front or behind your vehicle. I would have preferred only shooting backwards when looking backwards, but that's more an annoyance than an actual issue.Nice tracks, but could be better, especially regarding the Sonic themed ones. They are pretty and nice, but with some notable exceptions like the Samba de Amigo or certain parts in the Nights levels, don't leave a very lasting impression.The good:Very tight handling and physics, that, although annoying sometimes if you get stuck, make sense and play fair. The game also has certain permissivity on roads that have no guards, letting you leave the track for a very brief moment and correct if you're fast enough. Flying sections feel especially alright.Very good  weapon system that allows to escape homing projectiles, neutralize attacks and choose how many and in what direction to fire your weapons. No blue shells to be found in this game.Challenging AI and demanding circuits that make clearing level A tracks an actual feat. Although difficulty seems pretty uneven letting you dominate certain circuits while sweating for every inch on others, you'll more than likely find yourself fighting teeth and nails over a position.Good variety of modes, including not just a grand prix option, but a progressive career as well, where you can unlock characters and advance through branching paths that offer different challenges.Splitscreen as well as online multiplayer.Versatility in characters, thanks to the unlockable mods for the cars that will emphasize some aspects of the vehicles, making possible to specialize a character in an area suited to your needs.Great music and sounds. For the most part. See "annoying turd in a box racer".My closing thoughts would be that this is a very pretty, very fun to play game that, although suffers of some really friggin' weird design choices, has a very solid core underneath, with some really cool vehicles and tracks. If you can ignore those, this is money well spent on a very fun racing game. I'd give it an 8/10.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
 A game that potentially could have been truly great, marred by unpolished controls and lousy game mechanics I wish Steam had a neutral rating or sideways thumb because I would have picked that for this game. It's not a bad game but I don't consider it great either. It's a very decent game but with some significant flaws. I chose the thumbs down because I haven't seen any reviews that mention some of the glaring issues I find with this game. This is the most frustrating racer I've ever played in my life. The first major problem is the controls. Each of your vehicles (car, plane, boat) handle differently and they get progressively worse in that exact order. The car handles better than the plane and the plane handles better than the boat (by far).The car handles decently, but could have been tighter. The drifting seems to bug out occasionally.  I'll drift in one direction and then switch directions but my car still goes in the same direction even though I clearly pushed the thumbstick the opposite way. For the most part though it's solid driving. I found the cars to be the most enjoyable part of the game.The plane's controls are looser and more sensitive than the car's which means there's a greater chance of oversteering and flying wildly. I definitely feel less confident in a plane than in a car. But it's nothing compared to the boat, oh my god.The boat controls are absolutely awful. The worst I've experienced in any game. There is like input lag when steering the boat (to make it mimic a real boat I guess) but this inaccuracy makes you constantly over/under steer and it's very easy to go all over the place. After 40 hours of playing this game I still don't have solid control over it and still dread going into the water. I don't know why they made the boating so awkward.  This brings us to the second major problem: the game mechanics. More specifically the physics. When you are driving a car or boat and you get hit in the air by anything -- an opponent's weapon, the terrain, etc.,  your vehicle falls like it's in low gravity  (it also happens when going off a ramp/jump at a very slow speed). You will SLOWLY float down until you hit the ground or water, and depending on how high you are, can take FOREVER. This game has, without a doubt, the worst vehicle recovery time of any racing game I know of. It is not uncommon to take 3, 5, even 10 seconds to regain control because of the low grav or because your vehicle doesn't land properly after getting hit and you can't do anything about it. It really ruins the fast-paced nature of the game. If your boat goes off a ramp at a slow speed you can land in the water upside down and have to slowly wait till it flips upright. Sometimes you will float down on a rock and you can't move and gotta wiggle your way out. Or your car gets popped in the air by an enemy shot while driving uphill and your front wheels won't touch the ground; you are stuck there with your car standing on its rear end and the game doesn't respawn you. It's stupid and makes the game feel broken. Your vehicle should not drop in slow motion, should always land upright, and the game should automatically detect if you're stuck and then respawn you.Furthermore, when your car falls off the side it does not respawn you immediately. Your car has to travel for a certain distance in order for it to trigger the respawn. So if you drive off the edge at a very slow speed, you will slowly fly through the air until you reach that point where it triggers the respawn which can take extra seconds to do. Why they made it like that I don't know. The second you fall off it should trigger the animation so it always takes the same amount of time to respawn. Colliding with other cars is also extremely annoying because there's some wild bouncy physics going on. Simply getting nudged by another car can you send you flying off to the side. Sometimes hitting a car in front of you can make your car bounce backwards like 100 feet and come to a full stop! I've never played a racer where I was afraid to touch the other vehicle. It's something you just expect to do but in this game it can be unpredictable and you will consciously be avoiding contact with other cars. The exception is if you intentionally and forcefully bump them then you can be assured it will send them and not you veering off.The AI is brutal and awful and they will all pile on with attacks and bully you to no end. There is no invincibility after getting attacked like there was in the previous Sonic racer (Sonic and Sega All-Stars) so you can be in 1st place and get hit 5 times in a row and suddenly be last in the blink of an eye.The game's lack of polish is also noticeable by the inability to customize races in multiplayer. You can't change the number of laps. You can't enable or disable weapons or only allow certain types of weapons. At the end of a race the game randomly chooses 3 maps for everyone to vote on instead of letting you choose any map you want and many times one of the choices will be the map you just played. The game will randomly choose mirror track (which I HATE) which is a mirrored layout of the original map and you can't vote against it. There's no ready-up button in the lobby so everyone always has to wait the full minute before the game starts which is annoying. If you join while there's a game in progress you are stuck waiting forever in the lobby till it ends; why couldn't they let you spectate the other players? Or better yet, let you actually join and play and just not count the score to keep it fair. The game and the announcer will also routinely get your finished place wrong. The announcer will say you finished in 1st place when you didn't or the screen will show 1st place when you got 3rd.There's no free driving mode or practice mode in single player which is sorely needed in a game like this. You also can't change your controls in the game. You must exit the game entirely and enter a separate configuration menu.There is zero social interaction with other players. The voice chat is completely broken. All voices come through staticky and garbled whether you're in the lobby or in-game. There is no text chat in lobby or in-game. You might be thinking, who's going to have time to type while racing? You could type before the race starts, after you finish the race, or anytime you feel like it. The point is you should be able to chat in a multiplayer game. At the very least they could have put text chat in the lobby. The inability to communicate at all with other players doesn't make the multiplayer experience feel too different from playing against the AI.You also can't drive the wrong way (unlike the previous game). The second you try you get respawned. Now why would you want to drive the wrong way? Because it's always a fun and cool thing to do in racer games. If you're so far behind there's no chance of you catching up, you could say screw it and drive in the opposite direction to mess with the other players. Not in this game. My apologies for this long essay of a review. I wanted to be thorough in why I think this game is overrated and does not deserve the overwhelmingly positive rating. Because it's simply more frustrating than fun. You'll have tiny moments of enjoyment and the rest of the time you'll be screaming at your monitor wondering why the controls aren't responding the way you want or why it's taking so long to regain control of your vehicle. The game does have some nice levels to race on (and a few aggravating ones), the graphics are reasonably good, the music is catchy, and there's a decent assortment of characters to select. But those things don't make a good racer. It's the controls, mechanics, and gameplay that do. It's a damn shame because this game could have been really great -- a true contender to Mario Kart. But as it is now it feels like a pretty ok game that can be fairly rough around the edges.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												I played the 3DS version of this game for around 56 hours (with everything 100% achieved). While the PC version is reported to be the best one (actually the less worst one), it still shows absurd flaws that should not be present in what is supposed to be an AAA game from an AAA company like Sega. What is shown here is another rushed product.I agree that the essence, the core idea of the game is great and the tracks and mechanics too, but playing the PC version a bit is enough to show you that it's another port from XBox. Sega didn't even bother changing the button indicators, even if you switch the control to keyboard. Additionaly, game configurations are done.. out of the game, in a sepparate application you choose to open when you click the Play button on Steam. Controls, graphics and other configurations are all done in this application. If you want to change something while running the game, forget it. You'll need to close it before doing any other thing. To complete the list of observed problems, the controls configuration doesn't let you configure each sepparate key. Instead, it shows nothing and you have to figure what key does what by yourself.It's a shame for a company like Sega to publish such unfinished, rushed game like this one and if you want to spend your money in it, then go on. You really may like it and may not feel unconfortable with the problems it has, but it's a product I would not recommend to anyone.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												22/25 Gameplay8/10 Fairness8/10 Sound9/10 Graphics6/10 Controls20/20 Multiplayer14/15 Replayability ---87/100The biggest competitor of F1 Race Stars is currently Sonic & All Star Racing Transformed. Who will win the Kart race on PC?In Sonic & All Star Racing Transformed (shorter: SASRT) you are supposed to play single player to unlock more multiplayer. This means that you can play either "Challenges" (similar to usual Singleplayer in F1, but in F1 you do not unlock stuff) to unlock new roads or the campain where you have to win several kinds of races, but have multiple choices if you morely like this or that. But you can also do all. So it is up to you how much you want to play and if you want to choose a way to get a new character. For these you also need "Stars". You collect Stars by winning a race on easy (1 Star), medium (2 Stars) or Hard(3 Stars). Man, I love games with SO MANY UNLOCKS <3So you do not have to make the kinds of races that you do not like. And as their are many types of races (like normal, kill the others, boost, drive trough traffic etc.). But some of them are unfair- for me the traffic one.Another point why I just gave 8 points to "Fairness" is that you need good and powerful power-ups if you lay back in a race. In F1 you have these, not in Sonic though.The Sound is pretty nice, the Characters speak while driving but there is always some kind of childish dubstep which starts annoying after a time. Moreover the Sounds are always kept futuristic and sounds cheap sometimes. The Graphic itself is very good for a 1 year old game, but also: Everything is flashing, the houses next to the road are dancing...well- something for childs but not for me...The biggest lose in the points are the controls. A fun-racer with local split screen (which is awesome on PC) has to be easy to control to make it possible for your friends and family to be good at the game and to understand the controls. My Racing-Expert Friend just did not check how to get Power Start, Rolls, Boosts, Drifting and so on. And I did not check it in the beginning, too (which is not good). When we started playing F1 he instantly checked it all and was in the middle of the field.The Multiplayer is easy to set up and you can just do everything you want, as in F1 Race Stars. So 20/20 here.The game is pretty long, because of the many Singleplayer Stuff and the Multiplayer. It has like 20 hours on Singleplayer (or if you do 100% like...*cough* some *cough* people ;) also 60 hours ) and an active Multiplayer. It would get 15 Points, but I decided to take away one point for the hard Controls.So this is it!TL;DRIf you are looking for a Fun Kart Racer to play with family & friends sometimes - choose F1.If you are looking for a Fun Kart Racer to play Singleplayer or online - choose Sonic.

content:
Posted: January 18
												This is the best kart racer ever released period. Loads of karts, tons of characters to try out, and stages that are truly awesome to play through. Too many highlights to honestly write down in a single review. From Afterburner to Sonic and Panzer to Samba Di Amigo; someone will find something to love here. For me the Afterburner level was truly a great throwback and a beautiful level to boot. Of course, if you played the first Sonic game this one is more of the same, but with a polish not seen before. Land, air, and water racing have been added and they make a huge difference, giving this one a mellifluous fun factor not seen in too many kart games. The graphics have had a substantial update and everything seems like a general improvement to me.The game is compatible with Nvidia AA codes through Inspector, so you can get HBAO and downsampling to work; this is easily the definitive version this way. The consoles, when I played this on PS3, simply cannot compete with 4K and HBAO. The game just looks amazing and at a solid 60FPS too. I give the edge to Transformed versus its prequel, being that it added a wider variety of everything to the mix and the tracks are just insane. There are quite a few challenges like the first game and some secrets to find. The level variety is extremely varied as well. One of the all-time greats in gaming.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2013
												This is the best kart racing game since Mario Kart Double Dash. The graphics, music, controls and overall fan service are all well represented. Driving the boats can be a bit of a pain and there are a few glitches that hinders it from reaching the same level of quality found in Nintendo's Mario Kart series. That aside I would say it's amazingly a lot of fun to play the single player campaign. Mario Kart falls miserably short in comparison in this regard. Also the variety of characters is just mind blowing. The PC version has the most characters available and more are on the way. Keep bringing the content Sega and I'll keep buying.Final verdict: Just buy the damn game! It's way too much fun to pass up!

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												Hands down the best kart racer ever made. If you have ever enjoyed a game in the genre, you need to play this. Beautiful, vibrant, flawlessly balanced (none of that rubber banding or broken power ups like in Mario Kart), great course design, great sound design, great character selection, clever and memorable tracks, native 360 controller support. This is as close to a perfect arcade-style racer as you're ever going to get, and other than the minor annoyance of not being able to adjust graphical settings from within the game (there's a separate configuration program) it's a solid PC port as well.

												+ Challenging, skill-based gameplay+ Co-operative multiplayer for all modes; this includes grand prix, and the mission-based campaign, for example (local split-screen or online)- No windowed mode/windowed mode doesn't work- The character models are the worst looking part of this game- Vehicle and environment hitboxes are all over the place- The boat transformation is very clearly the most poorly programmed part of this game- Control inputs will not register randomly- It is unclear what actually counts as a "risk-boost"- Single-race perks/bonuses are tied to a RNG slot machine, instead of a "shop", or "upgrade" system- AI racers will be "balanced" to have the same speed as you. So if you're Sonic, with the "super speed mod" (the ony character with this modification), the AI will still go faster than you in a straight runaway, whether or not they are properly utilizing the boost mechanic- If you are in a online match with nearly empty lobby, the game won't put in bots to fill out the room; there is no option to fix this

content:
Posted: July 9, 2013
												On the surface, this looks like a generic Mario Kart rip-off starring lame Sonic characters. Actually play the game and you'll find it's a fast-paced, exacting racer. Despite the name, there are only 6 Sonic characters here. The remaining 20 or so come from all over the place, and some characters aren't even owned by Sega. Characters include Aiai from Super Monkey Ball, Wreck-It Ralph from that cool Disney movie, and the Heavy from Team Fortress 2. The selection available is pretty crazy.The character and stage selection in this game takes a page out of the "Super Smash Bros." playbook: many obscure and retro Sega franchises make great appearences here. This is all on top of an arcade racing game that's much more interesting than recent Mario Kart games.The graphics are great, the transformation gameplay keeps things fresh, and the game is just downright fun to play. I thought the previous Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing game provided some stiff competition to Mario Kart. This one blows Mario Kart out of the water.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2014
												I never played the first Sonic Racing so i have no ground to compare this to the first game, but this is truly a fantastic kart racing game. Being an old fan of classic sega i was glad to see the variety of Sega's generally forgotten characters being included in the game, characters from Alex Kidd to people in Crazy Taxi, Shinobi to Shenmue. Just Brilliant. The range of tracks pay homage to old school classics like Golden Axe too!Nostalgia aside, the game plays really well and you really get a feeling of speed that i find is missing from Mario Kart. The drifting and air flips that attribute to your boost really give you incentive to memorize these tracks, tracks of which usually change a lot by the 3rd lap as the area usually destroys dismantles itself by the 3rd lap! This is where the main comparison to Mario Kart comes in...If you love Mario Kart you will proibably like this game and will probably get a lot of fun out of it, if you like the idea of Mario Kart but hate the same old guff and repetitive stuff, you really owe it to yourself to play this. You'll have a lot of fun!(The weapons ain't all that great most of the time, but the actual racing more than makes up for it)

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												A very nice animated racing game for those who always liked the genre, great tracks, great music, and a nice crew of characters to pick from.The gamplay is easy to pick up for its simplicity, but as you go on playing, you discover there are some tricks to improve the general driving, like doing pirouettes on the air to boost up, finding shortcuts on the tracks, and mastering the items to attack other characters, and for those who seek a challenge, the time trials against developers' "ghosts" are really hard to complete. There's also an online mode where you can play with strangers or with friends, unfortunately, time has rendered online lobbies kinda lonely, and you'll find yourself waiting more than what you are willing to for a race that lasts barely a couple minutes, there's also local mode if you have several controllers.For those long time fans of SEGA, there are many references to previus titles, like Jet Set Radio, Space Channel 5, Wreck-it Ralph (oddly enough) and more; so it doesn't feel like just a re branding of a generic racing game, but as a part of the world this company has created over the years.The music is nice, upbeat and suits the levels, there's an anouncer with a very loud and over the top acting who will inform of the events during the races, it can be turned off for those who find it annoying, and each character has an unique song for their All Stars power, which makes it more enjoyable when you get to do it, and very frightening when you hear another player getting it.Overall, this is a very nice game to play either with friends or alone, it offers casual fun and big challenge as you progress, a perfect gift for a young kid and a completely non-shaming acquisition for a hardcore gamer fan of the genre

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												2fast4meGood graphics, gameplay is pretty much what you'd expect from such an arcade racer. Powerups are either OP or useless (especially true against A or S class AI drivers), but by far the worst (or rather, most frustrating and controller-breaking) part of the game is the difficulty at high levels (especially A class). The entire AI field is against you, which makes the first item pickup feel very bad, time trials are absurdly hard and everything is made to make the game a pain in the butt to finish. Special points for the "secret" S-class difficulty, unlocked after half the game and which makes you go through half the game you've already beaten.Overall an extremely enjoyable game, but finishing it takes ages.

content:
Posted: August 8, 2014
												Fairly fun game, though it's essentially just Mario Kart with different characters and different levels. Considering Mario Kart 8 introduced airborne parts of levels (though this game beat it to that) the similarities are still growing.The power ups are essentially the same (mushroom -> boost, banana -> blowfish, green shell -> firework, red shell -> drone and the swarm is pretty comparative to the blue shell). The tracks being riddled with crazy deathpits and booster pads really doesn't help the similarities, not to mention the easiest and best way to get ahead is drifting at every opportunity to get a boost.Otherwise? It's a fun game. It does what it's meant to, and there's a lot of offline things to keep just about anybody busy. The amount of unlockables is amazing for anyone really into the game, or really into collectables and the customization gameplay-wise is more than enough for anyone to find a nice play-style to fit their personal niche.Online play isn't exactly common though, often at times of the day there are 0 lobbies running to join, and I often found random disconnections in the middle of a game aren't fun. On the plus side, there was only often one game running so you'd soon be back in the next race with the same people.The inclusion of old classics is a very nice homage to the other things Sonic Team has created, as well.Overall: 8.5/10It's mario kart.. But sonic?

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												An impressive needle in a haystack of crappy Sonic games, Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed is truly worthy of competing with other iconic racing games for the title of "The Best One." This game will make you laugh, this game will make you cry, this game will make you rage until there is no tomorrow, but most of all, this game is addicting!Screw all the jazzy intro speech, lets make a pros and cons list:*I didn't bother with Online play, so I can't give an honest review of that feature.Pros:-Graphics are pretty darn good! crisp and clear, water is fluid and reflective, and the sun is even blinding! This is a game that will blow you away visually if you just finished a Mario Kart 64 nostalgia run.-The music is wonderful. There isn't a single track that doesn't make me feel strange, and they all fit very well with the environment. Sound quality for SFX is great too.-Plenty of challenges, and the game kind of evolves with you! Several different modes that will test different skills you didn't think were required to do well in each map, like drifting and boosting, and even knowing when to use a boost in the right moment. It also keeps the gameplay fresh, and you have to option of having a game with or without computers.-Competitive AF. Coms really give you a run for your money in this game. There is no "Easy" way to beat the hardest parts of the game, and that keeps things... interesting to say the least! It also helps you to hone your skills, and learn from your mistakes.-Downloading ghosts allows you to compete with people worldwide without ever needing to battle them directly! This also helps to learn from their driving skills, and improve your skill pool.-Mods allow you to switch things up so you can use your favorite character on more than one track away from their standard stats. They also provide incentive for continued gameplay.-Achievements and stickers give OCD Completionists something to do, increasing gameplay time for much longer.-Stickers and License allow you to show off your achievements online, and can be a testament to your skill.-Plenty of unlockable characters, many whose names echo down the halls of SEGA, and some who are just plain "WTF?" (I'm looking at you Ralph... I still don't understand why you're in this game... not that it matters. I love you.)-Multiplayer option for local fun, just like mario kart seshes.Cons:-Content may seem redundant after a while, mainly I am thinking "Complete the same task on a different course" or "OKAY now beat everything all over again but we'll just increase the difficulty," (this is after you unlock expert mode)-NO TUTORIAL!!! NO DESCRIPTION!!! REEEEEEEEEI had to Google what I couldn't figure out by fiddling with my controller, and there's no clear direction to help you understand the basics. The game literally just throws you in and you learn through experience. I'm still not entirely sure what the All-Star stat does, but my hunch is it determines just how amazing your All-Star ability is.-Hitboxes are irritatingly inconsistent, or just way too large. And this can work for or against you, but for someone like me who likes to drift as close to walls and around corners as I can, it sucks. Item boxes will sometimes be magnetized toward you, and sometimes you have to drive RIGHT down the MIDDLE of it to get the item. Sometimes, you will shoot a rocket or ice and think "I really shouldn't have hit them..." and sometimes Coms will hit you and you will rage "THEY SHOULDN'T HAVE ♥♥♥♥ING HIT ME!!" I have also squeezed my way through various narrows passages in plane mode, and other times I will hit what seems to be an invisible wall. Nothing makes me rage more than invisible walls... just kidding, the next thing is actually worse.-Coms are extremely OP in Expert mode. They have a handicap for all stats, so they will move faster than you, boost faster, they will get all-stars more often, and they seldom mess up on the map.-Coms will almost ALWAYS target you and only you, and in Gran Prix/Battle Race, it will very often feel more like 9vs.1 rather than a free for all. On expert mode, this becomes incredibly frustrating, because it is almost impossible to advance with people hitting you constantly. It forces you to play smart, and sometimes conservatively, or even recklessly... anything to win.-In this game, you ALWAYS start in last place, even in Gran Prix mode, which is kind of a slap in the face for traditional racing games. You ALWAYS have to fight your way to the top, and in no way can you earn a 1st place start.-All of the cons on Coms above lead into the next one: A lot of the time in expert mode, you need to rely on good luck to win, which is kind of a slap in the face to skilled players who truly know what they are doing, but are set up to lose. Even getting an All-Star is not a guaranteed win, and you will have to remain vigilant to hit those stripes first.-Some of the voice acting for this game is just... terrible... I haven't played as every character yet, but Shadow sounds like child with a pitch filter to make him sound lower and more "evil" I suppose.There may be more, but I can't think of anything right now.All in all, this game is like Mario Kart, Diddy Kong Racing, and Sonic Riders all mixed and refined into an amazing and diverse product. I may have listed a lot of cons, which may be intimidating, but I am also very critical, and maybe snotty. I am still having a lot of fun playing this game, as I have a LOT of stickers to earn still, and a lot of Time Trial ghosts to beat, and A LOT of mods to unlock. (Note to others, don't choose to be a completionist... it really sucks.)I'd give this game 8.3 out of 10. It's truly a wonderful experience, and it has it's flaws, but definitely worth the time.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8, 2016
												For some reason I'd avoided Sonic All Stars because I had vague memories of poor reviews; more fool me, as it turns out I was recalling the prior game in the series, which was nowhere near as polished as this one. Programmed by Sumo, who did the incredible PC conversion of Outrun 2006 Coast 2 Coast, this combines the same high level of graphical fidelity and the fun drifting mechanism of that game, with well balanced Mario Kart gameplay and a huge swathe of content, even if you don't get the optional DLC. Best of all, it supports local, split screen 4 player games, a rarity these days for PC, and even better, it allows you to take the 4 local players with you into online matches or anywhere you can reach in single player game, all with integrated team speak mapped to a controller. There are still people playing online, not a huge amount but it's still alive for now if you were thinking of getting this game...There are some minor problems of course; Like all Mario Kart games, weapons are still frustrating when you're in the lead and they're used against you. They aren't as wildly imbalanced as Mario Kart, but as the AI is rock hard and as only micro-seconds will seperate you from them, it still proves the decider. They're beatable, but often you'll find matches are won or lost on who got the random roll for better weapons.  Online skill shines through much, much more though and those who know the courses best and have the skills will race off into the distance.The single player has a huge range of content, which even 36 hours in I'm only just scratching; my profile says 60% complete, but that's just the Career and half the Grand Prix modes; Time Attack and Single Races remain untouched, and I've only dabbled in online play.  One frustration with Career though is that you'll run into non-race modes again and again on Career which halt your progress; whilst they do teach you vital skills (Holding Drift on corners to build up boost, hitting boosters to keep up speed, performing stunts to gain more boost) the challenges seem strangely placed so they break up the fun of racing, and can't be passed easily.  Don't hesitate to drop the challenge down to Easy just to pass them, but you'll need as many stars as you can possibly get to reach all the unlocks if you're a completionist.Also shame on Ferrari and their licensing for presumably denying the iconic OutRun Testarossa again; How many people I wonder grew up with those wonderful games and dreamt of a Ferrari; it was a remarkable piece of joint benefit for both brands. Now we get an ugly Daytona stock car replacement when we unlock the Ages character, and it's just not the same... Likewise it feels odd to see just how little of a roster of truly memorable characters All Stars seems to have. Surely we had more than Sonic and Alex Kidd over the years?  Where's Toejam and Earl, say? Licensing problems again maybe, but it does mean that the available characters are a strange mixture of cartoonish (monkeys throwing homing bananas) and super-deformed reality (General Winters from Company of Heroes 2 in a tank, submarine and Il-2 Sturmovik... eh?)  There's something for everyone I suppose, but it's hard to escape the feeling it's just 40% Sonic characters, 40% obscure punk ladies riding quad bikes, and 20% random fan service.  A small complaint, but it's there.But apart from these minor niggles, the gameplay is incredible, there's plenty to do, and the game is magnificently generous and fun in a way few PC games are these days. It truly brings together all the best of gaming past and present, the fun of being able to sit around one machine and dead arm each other to win dirtily, as well as online functionality with solid netcode.  If you're after a fantastic kart racer for your PC, look no further.

												A very nice animated racing game for those who always liked the genre, great tracks, great music, and a nice crew of characters to pick from.The gamplay is easy to pick up for its simplicity, but as you go on playing, you discover there are some tricks to improve the general driving, like doing pirouettes on the air to boost up, finding shortcuts on the tracks, and mastering the items to attack other characters, and for those who seek a challenge, the time trials against developers' "ghosts" are really hard to complete. There's also an online mode where you can play with strangers or with friends, unfortunately, time has rendered online lobbies kinda lonely, and you'll find yourself waiting more than what you are willing to for a race that lasts barely a couple minutes, there's also local mode if you have several controllers.For those long time fans of SEGA, there are many references to previus titles, like Jet Set Radio, Space Channel 5, Wreck-it Ralph (oddly enough) and more; so it doesn't feel like just a re branding of a generic racing game, but as a part of the world this company has created over the years.The music is nice, upbeat and suits the levels, there's an anouncer with a very loud and over the top acting who will inform of the events during the races, it can be turned off for those who find it annoying, and each character has an unique song for their All Stars power, which makes it more enjoyable when you get to do it, and very frightening when you hear another player getting it.Overall, this is a very nice game to play either with friends or alone, it offers casual fun and big challenge as you progress, a perfect gift for a young kid and a completely non-shaming acquisition for a hardcore gamer fan of the genre

content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												After having accumulated 10 hours of gameplay on this wonderful take on Arcade racing, I can safely say that it's done everything right! I never played the original S&AAR, but while this may seem like an expansion for it, it has an innovative mechanic: the ability to drive (or fly) on land, sea and air, sometimes all in one race! To start, there are several Characters, namely ones like Sonic, but others too, like Joe Musashi from Shinobi. They all have different stats, and are best suited to personal preference. There are many you can unlock too! They all have unique sounds and quotes, and some of their cars are insanely awesome to look at!It has 4 levels of difficulty, the last being unlockable, and after you learn how to play efficently without crashing into walls or falling off, it does seem rather easy, even on hard. Expert is a real challenge, the AI can keep up with you in rather tense races. The track design is inspired by levels from various SEGA games (hence the 'All star), and they are very original ideas, with each lap (normally of 3 laps) changing the track itself! You can find yourself on a simple land track at first, but all of a sudden: the track retracts and you're on water! The actual transformations happen rather fast, but still cool.The single player consists of a 'Single race', which is 3 laps and not tournament based. Career, which sees you progress by earning stars and going through a path of races. That being said, the game offers many varients of racing, such as traffic challenges, drift challenges, Versus and more! The Career is a bit shortwinded, however. Of course, 100%-ing it will take a lot longer than I have played, but to get to the end itself doesn't take all that long. The idea is to progess through the different Cups, and you unlock characters on the way.For the cars (planes, boats etc), you can alter their attributes by levelling characters through an XP based system. You will unlock 'mods' for the Vehicles, which can, for example, improve Handling, but at a cost of speed. This is useful depending on what type of race/track you're on.The online seems to be dead, through no fault of the games, but no-one seems to play it, which is a huge shame as there is an Arena mode! That said, if you have family/friends, get them a controller (or keyboard if you're feeling like that) and play together! A controller is definetly superior for this game, more precise speed/accelaration and handling. I use a keyboard, and fortuneatly, you can rebind. You don't need the mouse for this which is cool.Finally, the Graphics in the game (at max) are beautiful! For some reason, my game locks itself at 55fps despite V-Sync being off. It is well optimised and a smooth experience and you don't need a monster PC to run it, not at all! Loading times are good, the menu and in game interface are well designed and easy to use.I think I covered everything, please comment if I left something out. Overall, 9.5/10!

content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
												This is potentially the best kart racer ever made. It's a beautiful, fun and fast-paced game with great music, great characters, excellent race tracks and a unique gameplay concept. This is not just like any other kart racer, in this game you race with cars that turn into boats and airplanes in the middle of the race. These transformations are seamless and intuitive. All the vehicle types have their own unique handling, but at the same time feel similar enough to each other that it doesn't cause any disorientation. No matter which form you're driving, all the vehicles control perfectly. Rather unlike the luck-based whimsy of Mario Kart, the game is highly rewarding to skilled players; many of the items can be used strategically to attack or defend yourself from opponents' attacks, and there are even ways to evade attacks with homing items when one is unarmed. Snaking is not a terribly useful tactic in this game as it's very difficult to link multiple drifts across a straight. The game is more centered around thoughtful planning of boost charging and risk management.There is a huge variety of game modes and lots of single player content to enjoy. You can go through the World Tour to unlock new characters and tracks, or play through the Grand Prix for a more streamlined experience. There are also multiplayer battle arenas with their own modes such as deathmatch, king of the hill or capture the flag (or "capture the chao" in this case). The gameplay holds true to Sonic's namesake as the vehicles move quite fast and the PC version moves along at a perfectly smooth 60 FPS, although it can reach even higher framerates at times.There is a TON of Sega fanservice in this game, and you can telll the people who made this are really passionate about Sega's history. The characters and tracks are pulled from a large variety of Sega's franchises (such as Sonic, Super Monkey Ball, Space Channel 5, Crazy Taxi, NiGHTs, Jet Set Radio, Golden Axe and even Skies of Arcadia). On top of that there are many interesting guest characters in the game, such as Wreck-It Ralph from the Disney movie of the same name, and Danica Patrick, whom Sega is sponsoring in NASCAR. Not only that but the PC version gets several exclusive characters such as General Winter from Company of Heroes II, the Shogun from Total War: Shogun, Willemus from Total War: Rome II, and the Team Fortress 2 guys. More DLC characters are on the way as well, as Ryo Hazuki from Shenmue is already available to purchase from the store. If you fancy yourself a fan of racing games, or just fun lighthearted multiplayer games in general, you will do yourself a great favor by picking this up.

												An arcade racer featuring various Sonic and SEGA characters from classic and current games. 7/10, although I don't know who most of the characters are.It has a few mechanics from Mario Kart. 7/10 not necessarily a bad thing, because there are no blue shells. Instead you have swarms, bees that will line up in front of the guy in first place and they CAN be avoided. The other items are a LITTLE reminescent of Mario Kart, and there is at least a major difference between MK and All Stars RacingIt has boats and planes. This adds a different challenge to each map, some having boats planes and cars, or just having cars/boats or cars/planes. They also control fairly well in my opinion. 9/10Soundtrack is FANTASTIC. 8/10It has Football Manager as a character. 99/10 would listen to British accent again. Also no bugs regarding FM for once.Fantastic game.

content:
Posted: January 2
Product received for free
												Hello, everyone. Welcome to my review for Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed. Here, I will be reviewing each seperate part. Lets start with the World Tour mode.The World Tour mode is essentially a line of 10 (except for Sunshine Coast) races, with two characters (again, except for Sunshine Coast). You earn stars based on what mode you do and if you complete the challenge, and to unlock every character, you have to earn these stars. Doing it on Easy gives you one star, doing it on Medium gives you two, doing it on Hard gives you three, and doing it on Expert gives you four. This is how you unlock most of the characters, except for one... Lets talk about that.The Grand Prix mode is 5 cups, containing the game's 20 (21 if you buy Metal Sonic & Outrun Bay) races. The cups are in this order: Dragon Cup, Rogue Cup, Emerald Cup, Arcade Cup, and Classic Cup. But wait, theres more.  If you finish each cup, you can unlock the mirrored versions of each cup. Finishing these unlocks you Dr. Eggman. So, lets talk about the cast.You have Sonic & his friends, AiAi and MeeMee, Beat, and plenty more. Want to be a part of the past? Choose AGES. Want a unique car? Wreck-It Ralph has you covered. Do you even want to play unarguably the most annoying character?! That would be the Yogscast! (even if I don't find him annoying, just good stats and annoy others that find him annoying even though you can play NiGHTS with the EXACT SAME STATS BUT BEARABLE TO LISTEN TO! Gee, its almost as if they dont WANT you to spend extra money on their game... oh wait, Metal Sonic and Ryo.)Now, we should talk about multiplayer.Multiplayer is really good, actually. You can play with any character you have, even if you cant get back in first if you get hit by... anything, really. Its fun.Overall, I give S&ASRT a 'Yogscast has been eliminated!'/ten.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												This is Sega at their best. I was already a fan of the first one (played on the Xbox 360) and they made great additions in this "Transformed" version. I totally imagine this game being launched at the Dreamcast era.This is as good as any kart game can get: good old arcade gameplay with weapons and over the top races, local multiplayer to up 4 players and colorful graphics. If you're playing alone, you can try to unlock tracks and racers to your next game party. The Death Egg + Metal Sonic DLC moved to this sequel and the package is solid: various racers, a lot of tracks and all the traditional modes. I got goosebumps with the After Burner and Golden Axe tracks. The good part of all this is the PC requirements: my laptop with the GTX 740m 2GB runs the game at 60fps (and the loads are minimal in my desktop).Why there is no sequel to this is beyond me. I loved Sega at the 1980's and 1990's and there are still plenty of franchises to cover, like Altered Beast, Space Harrier, Fantasy Zone, Vectorman, Comix Zone and even OutRun. And they could ask to include characters from other franchises that made success at the Genesis era. Could you imagine Toejam & Earl as playable racers? You could take my money already, Sega.Edit 11th July 2016: there is actually an OutRun Bay stage and Space Harrier is present in the Race of AGES stage in form of music and hologram reference. So, there you have it, a complete package for Sega fans.

Buckle up and put the pedal to the medal in this high speed kart racer that hits the seas and takes to the sky.At the core it's the same formula of 'Mario Kart' dressed up with sega (and friends) characters and tracks.  Turns out the formula still works and creates a great looking racer that also plays well.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												It's like Mario kart, but more or less everything is done really well... which is exactly unlike Mario Kart. There's no idiotic bias for weapons based on your position, and it is a largely skill based ordeal.The AI can be a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥on harder difficulties, so if you get upset easily, but want to be a completionist (or at least unlock everything)  you might want to be wary. For 20€ it's more or less a steal, and anything below that it's a no brainer, which is something i don't say lightly. It also isn't just simply racing. There's some twists thrown in at times in the fashion of challenge maps of drifting, flying and time attack (solo) variety.The only gripe i have with the game is mild randomness in jumping physics in certain maps, especially in boats. If you just get bad waves off something, you can't consistently do flips/drifting to keep up your speed, which probably lost me a couple of races, but it's a small thing to moan about.Average playtime along everyone on friendslist: 22.5 hours.Average playtime along everyone on friendslist with the highest and the lowest removed: 21.1 hours.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2013
												The first Sonic & All-Stars Racing was... meh at best.  This is a HUGE improvement.  It stays fresh no matter what map or level you race on due to the vehicle changing multiple times per race from car to plane to boat, all which control differently.  Add to that 10+ unlockable characters and 5 stat mods to unlock per character and there's a lot of diversity here.  The maps are re-envisionings of classic games in a 3D track form and are extremely well done, featuring remastered and often completely redone BGM rom their respective game sources.  Lots of personality here and you can tell some serious thought was put into this.  Very well balanced and the multiplayer is never laggy.  Well worth a sale price.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												So, Kart Racers huh? Yeah. In case you've somehow managed to never touch one before, I shall explain to you very briefly what makes them good: varied and fun racers, varied, dynamic and gorgeous levels, a means of progression (unlocking new levels, racers or upgrades), cool pick-ups and sweet gameplay mechanics. This game has it all.One of the first things I noticed with this game is that the items are fair. Unlike the screwball items in Mario Kart, these items often give you a way to escape the imminent doom, and when it doesn't it makes sure that the user of the item had to carefully aim his weapon. There are no blue or red shells in this game, those suck. The catch-up item in this game is not an impossible-to-dodge blue shell, but is in stead a swarm of totally dodgeable obstacles on the road ahead, that can even help a leading racer to get a bigger advantage, should the driver dodge every obstacle. Other items include a homing cart with dynamite attached to it, which you can dodge by doing a well-timed stunt or jump, or some snowballs that require careful aiming to get right. You are never completely screwed in this game.Then another fact caught my eye: 'these levels are dynamic!', I exclaimed. Yes, the levels are already quite varied, fun and pretty, but they also actually change form. Some levels suddenly blow up, forcing you to morph into a plane (yes, you can do that too) and fly over the now destroyed road, giving you a completely different experience for the final lap. It's quite fun. And that brings me to another point, planes boats and cars. You have all in this game. The way they handle is pretty fun to play with, you have your standard car which handles like it should, then you have your boat which handles, well, like a boat. It's a lot more slippery in bends and it jumps up over waves, and now that I think of it, they are done pretty damn well. Very boat-esque. 10/10 would boat again. Yeah. Oh yes, planes. Planes are like restricted planes. You don't really dive up or down like you would in a normal planing game, it feels like the game sort of prohibits you from flying all over the place, for your own safety. It isn't like you can't turn around, not at all (if anything this game is too loose with your actions, nothing gets punished, which I love), but it just feels like it doesn't want you to turn around. It's done very subly and nicely, really.And then we have all the racers! There are like a thousand of them! You have Sonic and Knucles and Tails and Shadow and Eggman and Beat and, who could forget the most iconic SEGA character, Danica Patrik! Yes, everyone is here. And they have their own carts, too! The stats are done neatly as well, every character has wildly different stats, yet they also have their own mods, which shift over some stats from one category to another, fine-tuning your car for maximum comfort. Personally, I cannot play with anything but Shadow and his balanced mod anymore, I have grown familiar with his stats to a point where even a character with purely better stats would do worse in my hands. I just know exactly how fast he turns around bends and precisely what speeds he can reach, or how much faster boosts make him. Other people have this with other characters, but Shadow+balanced mod is my kind of jam. On one hand it's a shame that I have grown so familiar with him that I cannot play anything else anymore, on the other it's kinda really cool that I got my personal favorite. In any case, these characters work really well.All things combined, this is one of the best kart racers I have ever played and you should experience it too. It is pure joy. This game is absolutely an all-star in my book!

content:
Posted: August 11, 2013
												I was actually surprised at how good this game is!  The air/land/water vehicle transformation gimmick works out nicely, as your vehicle controls rather differently in each form, and the game includes kart-racer staples such as boosts for extended drifting or doing flips and rolls off of ramps (or barrel-rolling out of the way of obstacles when in plane mode)There are no lightning bolts or blue shells to result in cheap losses in this racer, and most attack items work almost instantly; your demise is entirely determined by how well the other guy aims regardless of any amount of defensive driving. On one hand, most attacks won't slow you down all THAT much, but on the other hand, regaining lost position is not as easy as most racers. If you fall to last place, count yourself lucky if you can get back up to fourth or third.Apart from the standard GP and single races, the game also features a robust "world tour" mode filled with challenges ranging from drift challenges, traffic dodging, time trials, battle races, and even boss battles against a tank.I'd definitely call this game worth trying, even if you aren't the biggest fan of Sonic and friends.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												This is by far the best kart racer I've ever played, and blows away any version of Mario Kart. The game balance is fine-tuned: There is no best character or best car, and if you don't like the way a particular character handles at first, you can unlock alterations. There are no spoiler weapons like blue shells. The races are skill-based, there aren't any ways to skip over massive sections of track a la Mario Kart.The design is incredible, several of the levels blew me away in terms of visuals.The game scales down well if you are running an older system (playing this on a laptop I bought in 2009).The AI is challenging. On the hardest difficulty, you will only beat them on the hardest difficulty by mastering the gameplay and then mastering the track in turn.Extremely worthwhile purchase if you have any interest in kart racers.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												An exellent kart racing game.   Simple but beautiful visuals accompany some very awesome race tracks as you transform from plane to car to boat trying to beat your opponents.   There are a variety of characters to choose from each with their own transforming vehicle.   The pickups are pretty good but nothing too special.   This game can become very fun online or when playing with friends.  Split-screen can be played online which is a plus.   Controls are smooth.   One of the best, if not the best Kart racers to come along in along time.+Controls great with X360 Gamepad+Graphics are pleasing and not too demanding+Variety of characters from the SEGA to choose+Split-Screen racing for friends.-Only 1 extra track has been released.  Needs a few more.-Touching other players in online races can have odd physics related issued.-
